fine_dining.name: FG Restaurant
signature_dishes: Duck with Foie Gras and Black Truffle
fine_dining.atmosphere: Modern, minimalist dining room with theatrical presentation
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book 2-3 months in advance, especially for weekend dinners
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef François Geurds is known for his experimental techniques; the restaurant features a 'taste lab' with over 200 salts

fine_dining.name: Parkheuvel
signature_dishes: North Sea Crab with Avocado and Tomato
Anjou Pigeon with Foie Gras and Truffle
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant riverside dining with panoramic park views in a modernist building
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reserve at least 2 months in advance, closed Sunday and Monday
fine_dining.local_tips: Request a window table for stunning Maas River views; their cheese trolley is spectacular

fine_dining.name: Fred
fine_dining.atmosphere: Sophisticated yet unpretentious dining room with open kitchen
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book 3-4 weeks in advance, closed Sunday and Monday
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef Fred Mustert offers a 'Pure Fred' menu showcasing classic techniques with Dutch ingredients

fine_dining.name: FG Food Labs
signature_dishes: Wagyu with Artichoke and Black Garlic
fine_dining.atmosphere: Intimate dining room in a converted railway arch with industrial-chic design
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reserve 3-4 weeks ahead, smaller sister restaurant to FG Restaurant
fine_dining.local_tips: Their surprise tasting menu offers the most innovative dishes; wine pairings feature natural and biodynamic options

fine_dining.name: Joelia
signature_dishes: Turbot with Fennel and Beurre Blanc
Lamb with Jerusalem Artichoke and Thyme
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant dining space in the Hilton Rotterdam with floor-to-ceiling windows
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book 2 weeks ahead, lunch offers excellent value with the same quality
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef Mario Ridder's cooking combines classic French techniques with Dutch ingredients; the business lunch is particularly good value

casual_dining.name: Fenix Food Factory
casual_dining.atmosphere: Converted warehouse with industrial vibe, communal seating and waterfront views
casual_dining.booking_tips: No reservations; arrive early on weekends to avoid crowds
casual_dining.local_tips: Combines several artisanal vendors including a brewery, cheese maker, and butcher; excellent for grazing with local craft beer

casual_dining.name: De Matroos en het Meisje
casual_dining.atmosphere: Cozy, maritime-themed restaurant with homey feel
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book several days ahead, especially for weekends
casual_dining.local_tips: No menu choices - everyone gets the same seasonal dishes served family-style; great value for high-quality cooking

casual_dining.name: Bazar
casual_dining.atmosphere: Vibrant, colorful setting in a converted church with lively atmosphere
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book for dinner; lunch usually accommodates walk-ins
casual_dining.local_tips: Enormous portions perfect for sharing; great for groups and vegetarians

casual_dining.name: Picknick
casual_dining.atmosphere: Airy, design-forward cafe with industrial touches
casual_dining.booking_tips: No reservations; weekends get busy for brunch
casual_dining.local_tips: One of Rotterdam's best breakfast spots; they roast their own coffee and bake their own bread

casual_dining.name: Ter Marsch & Co
casual_dining.atmosphere: Modern, bustling burger bar with stylish decor
casual_dining.booking_tips: No reservations; be prepared to wait during peak hours
casual_dining.local_tips: Their burgers have won international awards; pair with local craft beers from their extensive selection

casual_dining.name: Aloha Bar
casual_dining.atmosphere: Converted tropical swimming pool with riverside terrace and plant-filled interior
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book for dinner; lunch usually has availability
casual_dining.local_tips: Strong focus on sustainability and plant-based options; great riverside terrace in summer

casual_dining.name: Héroine
casual_dining.atmosphere: Hip, contemporary restaurant with open kitchen and urban vibe
casual_dining.booking_tips: Reserve for weekend dinners at least a week ahead
casual_dining.local_tips: Their 'no nonsense' approach delivers excellent food without pretense; great wine program with natural wines

street_food.name: Markthal Food Stalls
street_food.local_tips: The architectural marvel houses dozens of food stalls; try fresh stroopwafels made before your eyes

street_food.name: Rotterdamsche Oude
street_food.local_tips: Traditional Dutch raw herring is served with onions; eat it by holding the tail and lowering it into your mouth for the authentic experience

street_food.name: Kebab House
street_food.local_tips: Kapsalon (meaning 'hair salon') was invented in Rotterdam - it's a layer of fries topped with shawarma, cheese, and salad

street_food.name: Fritez
street_food.local_tips: Offers traditional and organic fries with over 20 homemade sauces; try the 'Rotterdamse Saus' for a local flavor

street_food.name: De Ijssalon
street_food.hours: 11:00 AM - 10:00 PM (summer), shorter hours in winter
street_food.local_tips: Award-winning ice cream with seasonal Dutch flavors; worth the queue in summer months

coffee_shops.name: Hopper Coffee
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Minimalist, Scandinavian-inspired cafe with focus on quality beans
coffee_shops.local_tips: They roast their own beans; pick up a bag of their Rotterdam Blend to take home

coffee_shops.name: De Zeeuwse Meisjes
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Cozy, nostalgic bakery cafe with traditional Dutch elements
coffee_shops.local_tips: Their Zeeuwse bolussen are a regional specialty from Zeeland; pairs perfectly with their coffee

coffee_shops.name: UEB West
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Industrial-chic cafe in a former water pumping station
coffee_shops.local_tips: Great remote working spot with plenty of outlets and large tables; excellent weekend brunch

coffee_shops.name: Harvest Coffee Brewers
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Bright, plant-filled cafe with large windows and contemporary design
coffee_shops.food_options: Full brunch menu with international influences
coffee_shops.local_tips: Among the best breakfast in Rotterdam; no laptops allowed on weekends to maintain the social atmosphere

coffee_shops.name: Lilith Coffee
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Minimalist yet warm cafe that transforms into a wine bar in the evening
coffee_shops.local_tips: By day a great coffee spot, by night a natural wine bar - perfect for both morning meetings and evening dates

bars.name: Dr.
bars.atmosphere: Speakeasy-style bar with vintage medical theme and apothecary details
bars.local_tips: Hidden entrance adds to the experience; bartenders create custom 'prescriptions' based on your taste preferences

bars.name: The Stirr
bars.atmosphere: Intimate, elegant bar with knowledgeable bartenders and vintage feel
bars.local_tips: Ask for off-menu classics; the bartenders are among the most knowledgeable in the city

bars.name: Kaapse Maria
bars.atmosphere: Industrial-chic bar in the Fenix Food Factory with waterfront views
bars.food_options: Cheese and charcuterie from market vendors
bars.local_tips: Run by local brewery Kaapse Brouwers; try their seasonal specials made in Rotterdam

bars.name: BIRD
bars.atmosphere: Vibrant jazz cafe with live music and artistic crowd
bars.local_tips: Check their schedule for live jazz performances; great for dinner and drinks with entertainment

bars.name: De Witte Aap
bars.atmosphere: Lively, packed bar on Rotterdam's coolest street with diverse crowd
bars.local_tips: Once named 'best bar in the world' by Lonely Planet; the perfect place to mingle with locals

bars.name: Ballroom
bars.atmosphere: Stylish rooftop with panoramic city views and DJs on weekends
bars.local_tips: The best sunset views in Rotterdam; arrive before sunset for the most dramatic urban vistas

food_tours.name: Rotterdam Markthal & Cube Houses Tour
highlights: Guided tour of the architectural Markthal
food_tours.booking_tips: Book at least a week in advance; tours combine culinary experiences with Rotterdam's iconic architecture

food_tours.name: Rotterdam Multicultural Food Walk
highlights: Surinamese, Chinese, and Caribbean food tastings
Rotterdam's colonial history and immigration influence on cuisine
food_tours.booking_tips: Reserve 7-10 days ahead; comfortable walking shoes recommended

food_tours.name: Katendrecht Culinary Journey
food_tours.booking_tips: Book early for weekend tours; includes a short water taxi ride for harbor views

food_tours.name: Rotterdam Harbor & Seafood Experience
highlights: Fresh seafood tastings at local fish markets
food_tours.booking_tips: Book 2 weeks ahead; weather dependent with indoor alternatives if necessary

cooking_classes.name: Dutch Classics Workshop
includes: Ingredients, recipes, full meal with beer and wine
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Reserve 2 weeks ahead; vegetarian options available upon request

cooking_classes.name: Indonesian-Dutch Rijsttafel Class
what_you_learn: Multiple small dishes for Rijsttafel (Rice Table)
includes: All ingredients, recipe booklet, traditional dinner service
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Book at least 10 days in advance; explains the colonial history behind this cuisine

cooking_classes.name: Artisanal Dutch Cheese Making
includes: All materials, cheese to take home, tasting of aged Dutch cheeses
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Book 3 weeks ahead; includes theory and hands-on practice

markets.name: Markthal
highlights: Iconic arched market hall with 100+ vendors
markets.hours: Monday to Thursday 10:00 AM - 8:00 PM, Friday 10:00 AM - 9:00 PM, Saturday 10:00 AM - 8:00 PM, Sunday 12:00 PM - 6:00 PM
markets.local_tips: Visit on weekday mornings to avoid crowds; look up to see the massive artwork 'Horn of Plenty' covering the ceiling

markets.name: Blaak Market
markets.local_tips: One of the largest outdoor markets in the Netherlands; best for fresh herring and stroopwafels

markets.name: Fenix Food Factory
highlights: Cheese maker, butcher, baker, and more
markets.local_tips: Great waterfront terrace with Maas River views; all vendors are local producers making products on-site

spring: Fresh Herring (Hollandse Nieuwe) beginning in late spring
Seasonal Craft Beers from local Rotterdam breweries
summer: Fresh Strawberries with Advocaat (Dutch Eggnog Liqueur)
winter: Oliebollen (Dutch Doughnuts, especially for New Year)
Bitterballen with Mustard at Winter Festivals
